title: Task 1: Describe a visual characteristic of the work of art shown.
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response. Each point is earned independently.
descriptions: Response does NOT accurately describe one visual characteristic of the work shown.
Response accurately describes ONE specific visual characteristic of the work shown.

title: Task 2: Describe another visual characteristic of the work of art shown.
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response. Each point is earned independently.
descriptions: Response does NOT accurately describe ANOTHER specific visual characteristic of the work shown.
Response accurately describes ANOTHER specific visual characteristic of the work shown.

title: Task 3: Accurately uses specific visual evidence to explain one way the artist creates a sense of movement in the work.
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response. Each point is earned independently.
descriptions: The response does NOT accurately use specific visual evidence to explain ONE way the artist creates a sense of movement in the work.
The response accurately uses ONE example of specific VISUAL evidence to explain ONE way the artist creates a sense of movement in the work.

title: Task 4: Accurately uses specific visual evidence to explain ANOTHER way the artist creates a sense of movement in the work.
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response. Each point is earned independently.
descriptions: The response does NOT accurately use specific visual evidence to explain ONE way the artist creates a sense of movement in the work.
The response uses specific visual evidence to explain ANOTHER way the artist creates a sense of movement in the work.

title: Task 5: Accurately uses specific contextual evidence to explain how the work shown is characteristic of other Japanese prints (ukiyo-e prints) from this period.
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response. Each point is earned independently.
descriptions: The response does NOT accurately use specific contextual evidence to explain how the work shown is characteristic of other Japanese prints (ukiyo-e prints) from this period.
The response uses specific contextual evidence to explain how the work shown is characteristic of other Japanese prints (ukiyo-e prints) from this period.
